content.detailedDescription: July 4th , 6:10pm. day sunny clear no clouds, on neighbors porch. she first spotted it and pointed for my husband and myself. first thing noticed that their was no contrail. retangle in shape , very fast, my husband estimated at 400miles per hour. approximately 10,000ft. located in south west portion of the sky. observed 5 minutes. on each side of craft two black pencil lines and waves. like heat waves off pavement.Very strange.My first thought was the talk of the aurora space craft? i live in the coutry where it is flat and wide open. we see alot of planes all day and we all agree that it wasn't like any we have observes before. thank-you. marcia
content.summary: Retangle no contrail 10,000ft. faster than a jet 400 miles per hour,approx. wavey lines at sides

content.detailedDescription: I was going home that night and i noticed it a star in the overcast sky. ithought it was strange but nothing special untill this "star" suddenly started flickering and shot north across the sky going from 70 degress above the horizon to 20 degress above the horizon in about two seconds vanishing. i told my wife about the object and she said it was a plane as we live in a high airtraffic area. today july 29, 2007 at 10 o'clock pm eastern time my wife called and said she saw the same thing. the sky is overcast and she is about 5 miles south of where i saw mine in beltsville.She said a star caught her eye in the overcaast, it was the only star visible when all of a sudden it shot westward from about 70  degrees above horizon to 20 degrees above horizon in just a few seconds. my wife does not believe in ufos but is puzzled as am i with a strong astronomy background. was wodering if you fine folks might have a cclue.
content.summary: First of a repeat oiffender

content.detailedDescription: Two friends and i were "camping out" on my trampoline in the summer of 1989. we were looking up at the sky when something flew past us. there were three lights appearing to be in formation. as the lights flew closer, we could see the outline of a single objects, which appeared to be the source of these three lights. these lights faded and extinguished and the object appeared to slow down. we could clearly see a triangular shaped object. there were no lights other than the three which had extinguished. after a minute or two, the object had passed our field of view and was gone.
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Triangular shaped object approaches, extinguishes lights, moves away

content.detailedDescription:
Bright flashing strone light size of moon or sun







my wife and i where on our way home from hawk's. i saw this bright flashing light.It was small at first. at first i thought it was the light from the airport near by, but you can't see this light fro that side of the mountian.And i saw no beam like you would when it would rotate.Plus th timing of this light was completely wrong for it to have been that.
as we got closer,the object in question became huge, and flashed rapidly im guessing 3 times a second. there was no noise. i turned on my caution light which is on top of my truck roof. it also flashes.I was trying to get it's attention. to make contact i guess. it remained in its position and we turned off onto 231 north and contuied. we lost sight of it behind some tall trees.
content.summary: Bright flashiing white light-like a strobe only the size of the moon or sun

content.detailedDescription:
Hello again,

what an unbelievable experience.  i was in the backyard for my usual daily sky-watching, and i saw what appeared to be a half-deflated mylar balloon.  this is a fairly windy area, and i have seen many things float by.  things such as balloons, both helium and mylar, newspapers, spider webs, plastic bags, and paper bags.  birds sometimes appear to be inanimate objects.  

in other words, i make an attempt to identify the objects as 'ordinary things' first.  therefore, i was fairly convinced that this was simply a mylar balloon which was losing its helium.  

i had my binoculars (16x50) but could not focus on the object.  it was silver, and through my binoculars it looked to be somewhat shaped as a 'hershey's kiss' on its side.  or possibly an acorn.  it was hard to focus on it, as it kept turning or reflecting light or giving off its own.  i don't know.

anyway, i kept looking at the object.  it was stationary at one point for about 3 minutes.  then it gradually came to be about directly overhead.  then it passed to my left, and i lost it.

about 1 minute later, it appeared again, but this time on my right, and then gradually went again over to my left.

then it did something no mylar balloon of which i am aware can do:  it started 'bouncing'.  that's what it appeared to do; bounce up and down as if on a yo-yo string.  that's when it disappeared.

but then something happened which let me know for sure this was no mylar balloon.  about 2 seconds after it disappeared, 4 lights immediately appeared.  then another.  and another.  possibly another, it was hard to tell as they were then moving in a perfectly straight line and going awfully fast.  it was hard to focus and keep count at the same time.  but at least 6 cylindrical shaped objects moving at a high rate of speed in a southeasterly direction.  i was able to keep then in view for about 15 seconds, after which time they disappeared.

this was approximately 7:40 in the evening.  no clouds in the sky.  still light.  some haze, but not much.  

this reminds me of the sighting earlier this week where someone reported two rows of 100 craft.  this was one row, and only 6.  but it was still something to see.

i do have a queston:  is there someone who would know if the earlier 'hershey's kiss' was possibly a beacon or locator of some type?  it's just kind of coincidental that it disappeared exactly when the other objects 'popped in'.


as to more events, i'll keep you posted.
content.summary: First object:  hershey's kiss.  second objects: cylindrical

content.detailedDescription:
I was riding in a car back in about 1982-83, crossing over a bridge in my home town of frankfort, new york. it was a clear summer day. i noticed a reflection in the sky to my left. i looked over and upward and saw a flying disc in the sky. it was moving in such a way as to not be hindered by gravity, momentum or inertia, moving as easily and quickly as shining a flashlight on a nearby wall. the craft was flying towards a cessna aircraf'ts windshield. it moved forward and back. it was extremely close at times. the aircraft's pilot reacted by diving the plane and trying to avoid a mid air collision. this game went on for several seconds as my mom aunt and i observed. it was pretty horrific watching this. the craft, as i call it, had a sort of pulsation coming from it. kind of like an unknown power system was engaged. i don't remember seeing any ionization. i saw the craft clearly. it was silver or almost bare metal in color. it was bigger than the aircraft. i saw it from the side as it never turned on its side. i assume it was round, but don't know for sure. i knew in my head that what i was seeing must be what many people had said a ufo or flying saucer must be. i'm now 37 years old and have been wondering if we can find the occupant or occupants in the airplane. now, that would be a real interesting interview at the other end of  the sighting. 
 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
i quickly became a believer and a researcher in the ufology field.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
i also have a second story to tell you. i'm not sure if its e.T. related, but i believe so. i go to a wooded area called russell park in the town of ilion located upstate new york from time to time, to walk on the trails. one night i snuck in late past visiting hours as i had done many times. it was december, about 3 a.M. when my friend and i decided to leave. we both were carrying flashlights. it was cold, maybe 20 something degrees. we were on one of the trails off of the main road when all of a sudden i felt a tremendous heat barrier. it was like being instantly thrown into the south carolinian countryside in august, and believe me i know i used to live there. my friend and i immediately took our coats off and were perspiring. the ground around us was bare mud and not snow and ice. the snow was melted in a circular pattern maybe about 12-15 feet in diameter. i made a joke to my friend that we must be in some sort of alien force field. i bent down with my flash light and saw footprints. i dont mean people and i dont mean animal. i've seen many animal footprints and nothing looks like these prints did. they had an instep and 3 pointy toes. i was pretty excited about it because i know nobody would be playing a joke on anyone in this remote area. my friend and i walked forward and were instantly cold again and had to put our jackets back on. i stepped in and out of this strange field. going from approximately 23 degrees farenheit  back to over 100. i took my hand and placed it in and out of this field. 
 
i decided to come back the next day to get one of the footprints. i remember there were about 20 or so. they seemed to stop as if something walking was talken back up. the tracks stopped in the middle of the snow. some of the tracks were in the snow and some in the mud.
 
when i came back the next day with my girlfriend, it was raining. most of the tracks were washed away to almost nothing. i found 1 track. i tried to dig it up with a shovel. it completely broke apart. i was very upset. now no one would believe me. i could show you where this took place if you ever wanted to see. or i could video my story at the place. 
 
i'm trying not to overwhelm you with my stories. i do have one more i can tell you in the next e-mail, one that took place in south carolina.
 
 if you want to talk about these instances you call give me a call. 
 
i'm home in the early evenings everyday......
 
315 894 8224
content.summary: Flying disk almost collides with an aircraft. i am an eye wittness.

content.detailedDescription: Driving west in troy with one other friend in vehicle. perfectly clear sky as the sun was setting. to the north west direction, i saw a large almost fireball with a streak or tail. at first, i thought it was a comet. the tail was not very long and moved with the ufo. it appeared at first very large and as if falling straight to the ground. it was somewhat high above the horizon, i would say i had to look up 45 degrees from level to see it dead on. it appeared to move slowly and we tracked the object for some 5 mins. the object then changed direction heading almost directly west. it also appeared to be getting lower and lower towards the horizon as some tree's were obstructing our view once and a while. when the object changed direction, the tail did not follow immediately. while the object changed direction, the tail continued in its original direction making the objects tail look bent or curved. the object then followed that course until it was too far below the treeline for us to spot it. during the drive i attempted to video tape the object with my friends digital camera however it did not have zoom and the object cannot be seen. we were simply curious to know what exactly the object was.
content.summary: Fireball with short tail/trail

content.detailedDescription:
My event happened several years ago...I have not reported it to anyone yet but friends and family members and thought i would talk about it now. this took place in phoenix, az in 1986. it was in the month of june and the time was around 2:30am, not sure anymore of the exact date. my wife and i were working at the warehouse for fry's grocery unloading (lumping) trucks. we had been doing this for about 8 months. at that time i was in school and we were working nights to support us. we were sitting outside the front gate of the warehouse waiting for the next truck to arrive, sitting in our car. the gate was about a 1/4 mile from the road. we relocated to california in 1987 and have not lived there since. 

it was early morning around 2-2:30am and there was a guard in the guard shack and one other worker, who was asleep in his vehicle. i was awake and relaxing, listening to the radio and my wife was sitting next to me in the car. at the time of this event i was smoking a cigarette and went to flick the ash out the window when i noticed a flash of red light that came from behind me at about a 45 degree angle. there were two buildings around 150-200 yards away from us. the two buildings were side by side with a driveway in between them. there was a parking lot in behind the buildings with a telephone pole set in about the middle of the lot toward the back end, this pole had a parking lot light on it which illuminated the lot. i looked over to the lot, where the flash came from and saw a glow coming from the ground. it was an orange-ish, reddish glow. at this time i was still sitting in my car with the window partially rolled down. my initial thought was, that there was a fire in the grass near the parking lot, so it caught my attention very quickly. i called to my wife and told her i thought there was a fire over near the buildings. just then a ball of fire (the only way i can verbalize what i had seen) shot out of the air and hit the area of the ground right near the orange/red glow on the ground. it appeared to come from about 100 feet in the air. as a recall there was just a partial moon that night and the sky was black, so at first, i did not see anything...This time i yelled at my wife that something was going on over there and did she see it. i said it was a ball of fire coming out of the sky and hitting the ground. just then another ball shot down from the sky and hit the ground again in the same area. that kind of scared me and i jumped out of the car and yelled at my wife to get out of the car, that something really weird was going on over by the buildings and could she see it. at that time i was now standing by the side of my car and was really looking hard to see where the fireballs were coming from. and then i noticed it...And just then it shot another fireball at the ground. 

now just to mention that there was no visible signs of a fire, just a glow on the ground about maybe 5 feet high and 10 feet wide and was orange/red. there was no explosions or bangs heard. there was actually no noise at all. and then i really saw it...It was a craft about 50-100 feet above the ground. it was pure black and had no lights on it at all. it looked like a top hat...Yet it was a disc shape but with a center portion that kind of squared off and rose about 6-8 feet. i would guess that it was around 25 feet wide. it was hovering over the parking lot and the light at the lot was somewhat illuminating it. by this time, my wife was out of the car looking over toward the buildings and the it fired off another fireball. to describe these balls, i would have to say that they truly looked like a fireball, maybe 3-4 foot in diameter. just then my wife kind of yelled and said "what the h*** was that?" all i could say was that i didn't know. she walked around the car and held me as we gazed over toward the buildings...I then asked her if she saw it. she responded with "the ball? yes! i did." and i said "no" the craft. she said, "what craft" and i pointed into the sky just about the buildings and said "there", "do you see it" its a ufo. just then she grabbed on to my arm and said "oh my god, what is that??", all i could say was that i didn't know. it then shot another fireball at the ground and we both jumped in fear. i asked if she saw that and she stated yes. i asked her if she saw what i was seeing floating above the buildings and she said "yes, i see it...What is it?" all i could say at that time was "it's some kind of space ship." oh my god what were we looking at?? i/we had never seen anything like it before in our lives. 

just then while we were staring at the craft, it started to move toward the road that came to the guard shack at the warehouse. i said to her, "it's starting to move, do you see it?" yes! was the response. it started to slowly move in a southernly direction, when it got to the road we were both frozen in fear and shock and disbelief. just as it reached the road it turned westerly toward us and started coming right at us. it was so low that i could of hit it with a rock...It traveled toward us and my wife started to panic and i told her to stand still and don't move. she was so scared...And was grabbing on to me really hard. as it headed toward us i became aware that there was no noise what so ever...It was absolutely quite. everything started to go into slow motion at this point, and i remember looking over to the guard shack to see if the guard was seeing this and he was in his booth with the door closed and the light on. it was only moving about 1 mile an hour if that, and it continued on toward us.

as we stood there in disbelief and amazement it flew directly over the top of us...No lights, solid black and amazingly quite. i could not see any windows or landing gear or engines or anything...I remember thinking that i was just frozen stiff and didn't understand why. i considered yelling at it and decided against it...Didn't want to make them mad or something i guess. it flew over our heads and flew down over the fence line of the warehouse. it seems like it got to just the about end of the fence line, around                                       500-600 feet away and turned to the left and then just shot up at about a 45-50 degree angle into the nights sky and was gone in nothing flat. again it made no noise what so ever. it took off so fast i couldn't believe it...Maybe around, i don't know, like a bullet being shot out of a gun or something like that...Just extremely fast....And then it was gone. strangest thing i have ever seen in my life...The reason i am now writing about this is because for years i have been reading articles and watching tv and videos about the subject and have never seen or heard about in the past a ufo shooting fireballs at the ground before...And i am most interested if anyone else has ever seen anything like what i have described. i believe i have seen pictures of a similar looking craft before and could still draw it our if needed.

about five minutes after our sighting, a truck pulled in and we jumped on it and went into the warehouse and unloaded it...Once we left around 7am we were to scared to drive in behind the buildings to see if we could see any burned spots or anything...It is something i have always regretted not doing.

and this is my story of what we saw many years ago...
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Ufo sighting shooting fireballs at the ground...

content.detailedDescription:
Driving home from ohio county park in hartford, we decided not to stay for the annual fireworks. it was almost dusk and the sun was setting. there are hills and trees here which make a nice back drop. i had been visited on several occasions before and had recently had an encounter up close while my husband was at work. i reported this incident to 911 emergency and the female dispatcher said it was just after midnight. i explained the bright white and red light hovering over the grass then. i was scared and said, "maybe it's deer hunters. the female dispatcher said, "they wouldn't be hunting this late at night." i was scared but for reasons i can't explain i felt foolish and said well never mind. i just forgot about it an went to sleep. when it happened again this time i wanted my husband to acknowledge the sighting with me. i got a feeling and on hwy. 269 i asked my husband if he could see this large ball of light. he said yes he could.First he said, it is probably just an airplane or helicopter from fort campbell. i watched it as we came down patterson rd. then it was coming straight for us toward us! i told tom then what is your helicopter or plane doing now? it was quite large and bright now and lower in the sky. much lower over the tree line and a white luminous like a star and was hovering in place. tom said, "it's just one of those whisper jets that don't make any noise." i asked him to listen for a sound before. we came up to the circle at carolyn lane and went to the end where we live. it sat now in front of our home. i asked tom if his helicopter that makes no sound but has a bright light follows him. he looked up at the light and said, "ok, it's a ufo, let's go in." i was shook up and don't remember much after that but i know we both took a nap which is odd for us until late about 11 pm. i went to the large window near the fireplace and looked out right where i thought the ufo would be. it was there hovering. i told tom to please come outside in the backyard now with me and to look. tom came out and acknowledged that the ufo existed. tom made me go back in and as we went back inside, i saw the white light jettison a red smaller light out and up which flew away and was followed by another. then it was gone. vanished in the night. you asked to answer the questions 1 thru 6.How do i feel afterward? like i always do after an encounter, i know we are being visited by ascension beings from another galaxy. this time i told tom i was going to record it with mufon. 
now, i know that somewhere in mufon those that want to know can find this.
content.summary: Eye witness with husband thomas r. morris

content.detailedDescription:
I was in my driveway viewing jupiter last night when i noticed a very bright and large object west (or perhaps wnw), approximately the size of a thumbnail at arm's length ("apparent size," in the astronomer sense, so a thumbnail or penny or so actually meaning very large). it was too dark to see any structure to the object, just the light it was emitting. it was also impossible to guess its distance, and thus altitude, but it was 30-40 degrees above the horizon for the duration of its visibility. obviously, i've never seen anything like it or even close. it moved against the winds to a ssw bearing as it grew smaller and eventually disappeared over the course of 3 or perhaps 5 minutes but maintaining a similar degree-elevation throughout. because of how large and bright it initially was i was struck by the conspicuous absence of any noise whatsoever. i tried to look at it through my telescope but it was moving too quickly to track, although still slowly enough for its size to have a floaty look to it. i'd estimate its bearing changed 30-45 degrees in the 3-5 minutes it was visible. i grabbed a pair of binoculars and was able to see it through those, but with no more useful detail. 

as i watched and tried to figure out what it could possibly be i had very few ideas. its size, silence, and brightness ruled out pretty much all aircraft, and i haven't thought of anything feasible all day today either. i have read about comets of startling size and brightness, although this object had no tail and its movement was near perpendicular to the ecliptic. i also don't believe it could've been debris burning as it fell to earth because its motion appeared to be at a consistent (if indeterminable) altitude. 

the fact that it was so large and bright and mysterious was a little spooky, but mostly i was just completely fascinated. at first i just stared at it for a minute or so. then i tried to track it with my telescope a few times. unable to, i grabbed binoculars that were just inside the house (running, for fear it would take off suddenly) and looked at it through those. 

when it disappeared i remember it fading in and out a bit when it was very small and dim and i could barely see it, which i remember reminding me at the time of an ember burning out, although i thought it was actually the same brightness but simply moving too far for me to see, or perhaps obscured by clouds i could not see. i don't know what the visibility was last night, although i suppose when looking at a light source all bets are kinda off on "visibility" distances anyway. 

there were actually very few clouds and seeing was good, although the transparency was poor as if the high humidity went to the edge of the atmosphere. for what it's worth, there was enough of a slight haze to obscure any real detail viewing jupiter although sharp lines could be made out on the moon, so it wasn't foggy either. i hope that gives some frame of reference as to the sky's conditions. 

i told some friends and emailed my mom about it this a.M. and she later found a site called myufo.Com which had a sighting in st. clair shores, mi with a very similar-sounding object, also for the last night (the 27th), at 9:30p- so approximately 1 to 1-1/2 hours before i saw. i can only believe it was the same object. although that sighting reported flashing lights on the object, which i did not see. it also reported a turtle shape and other detail but, as i said, i could not see anything but a fiery orange light. 

also, i would describe the shape as not really round, but not really square either. it's almost as if it were square but it was hazed over enough that i couldn't resolve even that much detail (something i hoped looking through telescope or binoculars would help with, but didn't).
content.summary: Large, bright, silent firey-looking object appeared in west and moved away, disappearing ssw

content.detailedDescription: I had been doing my email, around 10 pm, and was quite centered on the computer at the time. i don't know why i looked up and turned around to face the window, but when i did i was stunned by the sight of a large fiery-looking object in the sky. it was about the size of a nickel held at arms length, and was approaching from the east. as i watched it it veered toward the north. the color was a striking flaming-orange and looked totally unusual and out of place, so i looked at it through my 7x35 binocular which was on the bookcase near the window. i was able to see that under magnification the object was a group of lights surrounded by a halo, or oval ring that had depth to it. to the naked eye the object appeared to be a rather fuzzy, flaming-orange-colored circular mass. it was traveling horizontally, just above a wispy cloud cover that was moving in. it was moving quite a bit faster than an airplane, but nowhere near fast enough to be considered a meteor of any sort. it did not appear to be falling. at one point i noticed a bright star-like object which was near the object but traveling in a direction away from it. it appeared to be at the same altitude. i think it may have been released out the back end of the fireball object, but i am not sure. the orange object faded from view as it entered a cloud bank which was moving into the northeast quadrant of the sky.
content.summary: Slow moving misty firey-orange fireball with startling details when seen through binoculars

content.detailedDescription:
Although the skies cleared quite quickly, i first noticed something through the cloud cover. as an amateur astronomer, i'm quite used to looking up at the sky from my back garden in carlton colville (south lowestoft- uk) and as a smoker, i generally spend a lot of time there these days. 

what struck me at first was that this was a very bright star nw of my house, due to it's brightness through the cloud cover whilst no other star was visible. a few months ago and a few hours earlier in the night, i would have taken it to be venus; although in late july and at this time of night this seemed unlikely, so it piqued my interest. the cloud moved on revealing a clear sky and it still looked like a star, albeit a bright one and one that was moving. i immediately revised my opinion of it to be a satellite as it moved with the  kind of speed and with the appearance of one, although i was surprised at how bright it was. then it stopped... 

this seemed to blow my theory that it was a satellite and my thought then was that it was a helicopter. there seem to be a lot of helicopters around this area at night... the police have one to cover the area and there is a heliport about 10 miles away just outside of beccles. i waited for it to reveal itself as such. after around five minutes had past however (the time it took me to smoke another cigarette) it didn't move at all and for all intensive purposes looked just like a star. when it began to move again, this time at a slower pace than before, i wondered what it could be. it stopped again, although it seemed to be moving ever so slightly every now and again in a subtle but somewhat erratic manner. if it were a person sitting on a seat, you would say that they were fidgeting.

every now and then it seemed to move very slowly in a ne direction and occasionally make adjustments. as i watched, i looked at the other stars around it to try and judge how quickly it was now moving. i noticed two stars above it that were quite dim in comparison and formed the shape of a triangle alongside the bright star. when it appeared to move again though, the two dim stars appeared to move with it. it was at this point that i realized that the triangle pattern was moving in formation in relation to the other stars. it continued to move about for a further 30 minutes, although by now i had begun to doubt what i was seeing. 

as my eyes adjusted to the light (i'd spent around 40 minutes in the darkness by now and my garden is quite sheltered) i thought i could make out edges that joined the three stars. it appeared to be a black triangle shape. as it continued to move erratically for the next hour or so, i could not take my eyes off it. it appeared to be about 500ft up and would have been directly over marshland and the broads. although i am not accustomed to estimating altitude, i had a good reference fresh in my mind as i'd spent the day at the town's annual seafront air festival. seeing a variety of planes flying over the sea gave me a good yard stick in this instance. 

although i had appeared to witness definite movement, i began to wonder if i had indeed imagined it. after craning my neck for such a long time, i was keenly aware that my eyes may have been playing tricks on me at this point but every time i convinced myself that i wasn't seeing this at all and that i should go to bed, it made a larger movement again and hooked me in. it was almost like it was teasing me into staying to watch.

things started to get a little stranger after that. at one point, cats started to scream and dogs began to howl. i've never heard such a chorus before and i felt a bit scared at this point. this seemed to go on for a few minutes, throughout which my own cat peered out of the cat flap quite apprehensively. as suddenly as it had began, the chorus stopped and i was back to staring at this enigma again in complete silence. 

at one point a cloud passed over it again and there seemed to be a flash of light emanating from behind the cloud. by this time, i had been watching it for about 1hr and 45 minutes. throughout this time i had continually doubted what i was seeing, but i was suddenly utterly convinced that what i was witnessing was something extraordinary. it was then that the ball of light appeared. 

it didn't seem to come out of the triangle, rather it appeared slightly below it and to my eyes was instantaneous in it's manifestation. this was a  real 'bloody hell!' moment and i was utterly mesmerized by it's luminance and size. bright like a flare, it seemed to be white in the middle but    orange around the edges and it moved very steadily down from the triangle and began to move directly overhead. although it at first seemed to be a ball, it was actually a little fatter in the middle-- a squashed ball if you will. at this point i freaked out and rushed into the living room to get my camera. although fumbling through the drawer for the camera felt like a lifetime, it couldn't have been more than 20 seconds and by the time i got out of the house it was directly overhead, above the house. it now appeared like the shape of a jelly bean from my vantage point beneath it. 

unfortunately, my digital camera's a relatively cheap model and by the time it had fired up to take a picture, the object had gotten a little more distance, although was still relatively close to the house. as i took a picture, the flash went off and i cursed as i quickly tried to change the picture setting to one without the flash. by the time i'd gotten the camera sorted, the object had moved quite a distance, faster it seemed after it had left the proximity of my house. by this point it was quite small and finally stopped somewhere in the distance. i really couldn't say how far away it was now, a few miles perhaps? maybe less? there it seemed to stop. as i turned back to the triangle, it was no longer there. i watched the orange ball for a further twenty minutes during which it seemed to ascend very slowly. finally, after about 30 minutes, a cloud obscured the ball of light which at this point was about the same size and coloration as mars, which was shining to the se of the object.   

i have included the picture i took with the flash on as i staggered out of the house. at first, this looks like a black and empty picture, but by turning up the brightness and the contrast of the image it appears to have a little more structure. i'm well aware that the picture is almost laughable as evidence and is a very poor representation of what i witnessed, but it's better than nothing... i've also included an enhancement in which i have increased the brightness and the contrast.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path then hovering
content.summary: Black triangle stationary, moving at a medium pace at first, then making slight slow movements... followed by a orange slightly elongated ball that appeared close by and flew overhead.

content.detailedDescription: I was siting in my living room playing the computer when i herd a tap on my window it was my neighbor and he took me outside it was almost blinding white color and i was shocked i ran inside to get my neighbor when we were back out they were gone and left no trace of ever being there i stayed outside to see if they might come back and i saw another alien life form more far away and in a stars form it was flashing bright red and blue and split in two then disapered deep in space im telling everyone aliens r real
content.summary: 4 bright white discs and a flashing red and blue star

content.detailedDescription: Was driving home the other night. heading south on a main road in the center of mobile, al. sky was clear. i noticed 2 orange lights appear about 11 o'clock from my position. star-like, but orange. time was 10:30ish they appeared to be approx. 15 to 20 miles away and about half way up the horizon. there was a truck in front of me, and i said i know he is seeing this too. they just materialized out of nowhere. as i was having to concentrate on the road, i wasn't staring at the lights. i glanced back at them, and about that time, the light on the left formed 7 or 8 same size orange lights. the formation they were in kind of resembled geese in formation. you know how those certain kind of fireworks that they make to resemble a star or heart or shape form in the sky? that's what they looked like. when i say that'a what they looked like, i mean when they disappeared they resembled those certain kind of fireworks. they just seperated and disappeared. and that was it they were gone almost as quickly as they appeared. whole thing lasted maybe 10 seconds. when i originally saw it i thought it was ahelicopter, but i don't think so. i will say this i have seen ufo's on 3 other occasions, and if they are from another galaxy, 1.At this time they don't want to be seen. 2. i have mixed feelings about why they are here and, what their intentions are. thank you for reading and have a good day.
content.summary: Orange lights in sky

content.detailedDescription:
My partner and i were vacationing at the ritz-carlton in cancun. after dinner we went out to see if we could find sea turtles laying eggs. it was a clear night and the moon had not yet risen. all of a sudden, as if "it" was calling to say look over here, this circular object appeared from the northern horizion. we were watching the slight glow to the east because the near full moon was about to rise and we both were drawn to look north.
the object was round and about the size of a dime held at arms lenght. not quite sure of its altitude but i can guess at 30,000 to 50,000 feet. its heading was north to south at an increadible spead.From horizion to horizion it could be seen for not quite 10 seconds. dark orange in color. no noise and no contrail.
content.summary: Dark ogange object sped across the sky

content.detailedDescription: I was at the orange county fair on 7/21 and noticed a group of people looking at a strange object in the distant western sky at around 10:30 p.M.  the object would hover and dart in no apparent pattern.  it moved very quickly.  it had bright lights on its base.  the lights formed a circle.  there were approximately twelve such lights.  my feelings were that it was a strange sight and i confirmed those feelings with the handful of strangers that were observing the event with me.  eventually, the craft descended low on the  horizon and disappeard.  it seemed to be heading westward over the ocean.  i have two very poor-quality pictures that i would be glad to append.
content.summary: A saucer-shaped object with white lights on base

content.detailedDescription:
After a long day of backpacking in isle royale national park my group, which comprised of myself, my dad, and brother decided to sit by feldmann lake and watch the spectacular northern lights.  immediately after the show had ended one of us noticed a very, very bright object high in the sky to the left.  it got brighter, moved from right to left in an indirect motion, speeding up and slowing down, and then go dim until it completely faded.  it looked as though it got near us and then left.  we noticed the object because it was so intense compared to the stars and other objects in the background.  when we noticed it, and it's erratic flight path, i didn't think it was a meteor, or other natural space object, and it did not behave like a plane.  afterwards we were all speechless.  no one had any idea what it was, and we didn't talk much about it because of how strange it was.    

i attached a map of the area.  we were on the west side of the lake i believe, looking north-east.
content.summary: After the northern lights, me and two other witnesses saw a light move around and vanish.

content.detailedDescription: At the time i was 1 block east of the fox river looking northeast towards the city of bartlet waching the commercial on there final approach to ohara field. i obsevred an object that first thought to be a high flying bird. i then saw the object move around  and above the jet in short right hand turns. it then moved to straight east of me,made some irregular moves. then it went straight south towards aurora at a  very high rate of speed. at all times it made no sound. no bird can move like this. i cannot explain what saw, but it makes no sense what it was.  this also was seen by my son who standing with me
content.summary: High flying craft near commercial jet

content.detailedDescription: Saw a fleet of white spheres over my house, but after three years of attempts at a response, i give up and have to conclude that mufon is a joke.
content.summary: You have my three reports, and photo's, read them

content.detailedDescription: I was watching tv when i herd jets from china lake naval base fly over my house as thay do all the time but this time thay were so loud i couldnt hear the tv (and i play it loud) so i step out my back door i look up an see 4 jets wingtip to wingtip i couldnt see the jets but i could see each of there red tail lights and there afterburners i was thinking man you guys are flying low an fast for this time of night so i started to step back into the house an out of the corner of my eye i  saw a light comming from the east just south of the trona pinikels theres a small montain range that runs east to west an crosses the 395 hwy dies into the desert just before hwy 14 and the sierra mt range as i watch the light i can see this sphere or (foo fighter class ufo )is moving and moving fast it was flying just above the mt range and about the time it got to the 395 hwy the mt range starts to brake up and thats when i saw the smaller sphere flying right below it i never lost site of the big one the hole time but i did with the smaller one every time there was a brake in the mt range i could see the small one an i was in shock after thay past the last mt in that range i watched in shock as thay blinked out about the time thay pass over hwy 14 at the same time just like someone turned off a light switch im an old marine i have seen all kinds aircraft an that was not from this planet the big one had to be 2 or 3 hunderd feet in diameter the small about 1/4 the size of the big one after that i put on a pot if coffee and watched the night sky all night no lie i guess i was in shock the navy was looking for it most of the night i watched them fly over the area where the ufos blinked out for hours the hole sighting lasted about 8 sec in that time the ufos traviled about 40or 50 miles i dont know how fast that is but thay where cooking  this is a true story and ufos are real.
content.summary: 2 foo fighter class 1 big 1 little

content.detailedDescription: My son and i went out deer hunting before dawn and split up to go to our separate spots, about a half mile apart.  shortly after i got settled, a glowing white sphere suddenly switched on in the shallow valley below me and slowly meandered around the trees until i lost sight of it as it floated deeper into the woods and then over a pond. the sphere was about eight feet in diameter and hovered about five feet off the ground.  when i reunited with my son, several hours later, he described the same object to me without me having said a word to him.
content.summary: Eight foot glowing white sphere suddenly switched on and slowly floated through the woods at five in the morning.  witnessed by my son and i.

content.detailedDescription:
My daughter and i were out in the country, where it is darker, to get a better view of the comet that was visible in the north west about eight to ten years ago.

i looked around the sky and found the ursa major and noticed a moving 'star' then another and another and another. 4 in a row moving south south east. nevertheless, i thought they were sattelites. but, as i watched the last two made and instant ninety degree course change and began moving west south west. i don't know if sattelites can make a course change so i thought i'd let you know about it.

your web page will not allow me to say that this was in alberta canada. in order to report this i had to say i was in alaska usa
content.summary: 4 units with course change

content.detailedDescription: Jogging last winter.  cold with an inch of snow on the ground. very high/far sky visibility.  i had a slight back ache.  at the time i was at the eastern portion of central louisville and would have been facing north-east. i arched my spine in an attempt to pop my back when something caught my eye.  my field of vision was well above house top level when i noticed a very bright pair of shapes.  i was reminded of high hat cymbals. the top was long slender and disk shaped, the bottom part was more of a line than a disk.  they emanated a bright white light with a slight blue tinge.  i was reminded of the light produced by an arc welder.  there were no details i could discern on either form they also seemed flat.  they were closing distance with  each other but i'm not sure if they were coming together or one was meeting the other.  the forms were very clearly well above air traffic level (which was also highly visible that night)and also very distant based on clouds as a reference. i would imagine these objects to be fairly large. the two forms combined and vanished, there was no flash, sound or movement.  i noticed that when i blinked for a short time an after image of the objects would appear. i remember feeling excited and transfixed.  i stood at that spot for another 30 minutes gawking in that direction and panning around but saw nothing else.
content.summary: High hat cymbal shape brightly lit, very distant but clearly large

content.detailedDescription: I was going home from work and noticed three red lights coming towards me.  i grew up near an airforce base, so i instantly knew that something wasn't right about the lights.  they were kind of low for an airplane in this area and they weren't blinking.  there were no other lights like the strobe lights that usually are on airplanes.  i was in the left turning lane about to turn, so i wasn't moving at the moment.  as i sat looking up the object passed me at the 10 oclock position.  i rolled the window down and stuck my head out to get a better look.  there was absolutely no sound at all coming from it.  i was on the out skirts of town and there was no traffic in the area at all so it was quiet in the area.  if there were any sound coming from it i would have heard it.  it was very dark out, but the object was low enough for me to clearly see the silhoutte, a triangle.  it was going rather slowly and appeared to be not very far above the tree line.  if i were to guess i would say it was only a few hundred feet in the air.  as i sat watching it, the object continued on towards the city and out of sight.
content.summary: Triangular with one non blinking solid red light on each corner

content.detailedDescription: On the night of august 24th 2006, from my porch while smoking a cigarette i noticed a moving red ball of light aprox. 5 miles wnw of my location moving through the tree line in an elliptic pattern.  unsure of what i was looking at, i ran in to grab my nikon 7300 7 megapixel digital camera and shot a sequence of 4 pictures, i used the night landscape setting so the flash would not go off and placed it on my tripod.  the first 3 photos taken i zoomed in at the 10x optical zoom and could not distinguish what i was seeing from the background photons collected, however when i used the 500x digital zoom i was able to snap a great shot of a disc shaped object with symmetrical designs on the exterior of the object.  my wife and i observed the object for around an hour before calling it a night and going to bed.  then next day i used my photoshop elements 4.0 program to adjust the levels and attempt to brighten up the pictures a little to see if there was anything i missed, as the original seems to just be all black with only a small indication of anything in the lower left hand corner.  to my astonishment when i used the autofix, feature on the photo the image enclosed is what was revealed, a very convincing ufo picture.  i have enclosed the original and the adjusted levels picture for your to analyze to see that the original is actually the picture i took with my camera, and only after the adjustments were made was i able to make out any sort of shape of the object.
content.summary: Noticed red ball of light moving through the tree line, snaped multiple photos included best shot with enhancment and original photo

content.detailedDescription:
i took these pictures from my balcony, and outside my apartment.  i first noticed objects after downloading chemtrail, weather,  and sunset pictures.  i noticed the first objects in pictures taken june 27, 2007, in the late afternoon.
   i was excited to see these, and continued to photograph, and have taken pictures of many ufo's of various sizes and shapes almost daily since then.  at times there are dozens, maybe more than one hundred in the sky, mid to late afternoon.   in many pictures, there are beings of different types, including what appears to be families and pets, as seen through the ufo windows.  
   some of what i have seen is awe inspiring.  i have photographed directly under some of these craft.  i have felt it to be a friendly presence.  
   
  the pictures speak volumes.  http://www.Picasaweb.Google.Com/dsholter
content.shape: Blimp,  Boomerang,  Bullet,  Missile,  Cigar,  Cone,  Chevron,  Circle,  Cross,  Cylinder,  Diamond,  Disc,  Egg,  Fireball,  Flash,  Oval,  Saturn-like,  Sphere,  Square,  Rectagular,  Star-like,  Teardrop,  Triangle,  Other,  Unknown
content.summary: Daily event since june 27, 2007 - groups of ufo's gather about 4pm to after 8pm

content.detailedDescription: During a recent trip through arkansas on 7/23/07 i was a passenger riding in the back seat of an suv with a trailor hitched on the back.  we were driving on 67 heading northward around 4:30 am.  i wasn't paying close attention but we must have been in or around the tuckerman area at this time.  as a back seat passenger and a pulling a trailor, my view was somewhat restricted.  what i did see out the side window, over a farm field to my right was a blueish white triangular shaped (edges somewhat rounded) object, with one round light on each side and three or four on the bottom.  the lights were steady, didn't blink or pulsate and it was bright but had a muted softness to it (hard to explain).  it didn't appear to be moving, or else it was moving very slow.  i've never seen a ufo before so it kind of stunned me and creeped me out.  i don't know if it was a ufo or just some kind of lamp type light i've never seen before but it certainly didn't look like it was attached to a post of any kind.  i didn't want to mention it to the people i was with because they were busy talking and probably didn't see it, plus i was afraid they'd think i was nuts.
content.summary: Strange looking blue lights over a farm in arkansas off hwy 67

content.detailedDescription:
I was with my wife in our back lot.  i am a mufon member and amateur astronomer and astronomical illustrator, so watch the sky for weather and air traffic. we are in the approach area to large airports oakland international, sfo.  we have seen these or similar on several occasions, some corroborated by friends across town, so always try to scan when out.

at approximately 6:35pm i noticed a white spherical object due south at 45-50 deg.  distance and altitude hard to determine.  i then saw a second, then a third smaller by 50-75% but both at about 20 deg. of arc from the original object. one at 11 o'clock the other at 5 o'clock.  i could detect no movement but an imperceptible drift north as time passed.

i observed them by eyes only with correct distance glasses while my wife went for my watch, camera and video cam.  at one point i thought i saw one of the smaller secondary objects split, but could not be sure.

i started shooting with my digital slr (pentax *istd) with a standard macro zoom f-lens 1:4 /70~200mm.  i took 45 images jpeg at 6 megapixel resolution and 3 in raw format that did not resolve well enough.  i could not see structure through the lens.  only a fairly indistinct sphere.  my zoom was at max (200mm) most of the shots, but took several exposures at wider field including a set showing an aircraft, passenger airliner at high altitude in a sky lane usually for routes la to seattle.  this one from south going north.  taking those particular exposures at 1-2 seconds apart.

at this point i called  mufon nor cal director ruben uriarte who is a couple miles from me, but could not get him.  i next called another mufon member (don) a friend about 4 miles west of me to see if he could see the object and we could triangulate, but he could not see them with naked eye or with his telescope.  he did tell me he saw earlier a similar object that split, and was positive what he saw was not conventional objects.  he stayed on the phone so we could continue to observe and discuss.

after i felt i had good images, i changed to my hi8 sony digital handycam with steady shot and super night vision.  i got approximately 6 minutes of video.

i was not able to resolve detail in the low-res video cam viewfinder, although i could see some structure artifacts in the video on review.  i continued to watch as several aircraft went overhead at what seemed a much lower altitude.

don told me the clouds (fog from coast) covering view from his position.  we where still clear skies from our own observing position, but prevailing winds would carry them this way.  i continued to look but i saw that the object had traveled a good 40-50 degrees of arc and viewing angle was now at 50-55 degrees and would be obscured by the large liquid amber tree on the street in our line of sight.

wind was about 5-10 mph at ground, but as the coastal fog clouds came in from the north moving south at what looked like 500ft at 10-20 mph and was crossing over the more distant object, again that was moving north at a very slow but deliberate rate.  i was able to keep the object in the viewfinder as the clouds crossed over it, giving me a good indication that the object if a balloon was in a much higher altitude with calm winds moving north, against the lower level.  possible but lower probability.  when the object went into the tree i changed position, but could not see the object after that.  i shot a few seconds in case i could resolve it in review but could not.  i recorded then my position and viewing angle in video for the record.  by then coastal fog clouds had covered us.

i immediately reviewed the images (i am a digital graphics specialist) and found that the slr digital camera had resolved structure, but amorphous or changing shape.  it could be construed as a bunch of balloons, but was not consistent therefore unlikely.  the shape was somewhat like a center spire protruding vertically and top and bottom with spherical shapes around it, sometimes in a horizontal orbital configuration, but changing second to second.  if a bunch of white balloons where being buffeted by wind that violently they would also be moving faster in the sky, and, with prevailing winds likely.  don came right over and we ran some filtering to see any hidden details or other objects, but that was largely inconclusive.

after reviewing video i found that details where less striking but did record cloud movement in relation to the object and at one point, saw the secondary object moving non-relative to the main object.

i have available 39 good exposure stills in jpg and 6 minuets of video in 3 formats.  1 format was direct to dvd and the other two are direct to mpg from cam and dv video files.  i will archive on a dvd data disc.

video not ready for transfer as of this report date, but will be added later.
content.summary: Amorphous white object and 2 companion objects

content.detailedDescription:
Arrived on holiday in varna bulgaria late in the evening of the 16th july 2007. unpacked and then sat on the hotel balcony having a (first ) glass of wine. was amazed to see three star like objects travel swiftly low across the sky from south to north at very high speed. the objects seemed to be not in strict formation, but bobbing and weaving around. there were planes in sight at high altitude moving across the night sky with navigation lights flashing. these objects were certainly not comercial aircraft. the speed was very great as they moved from my right hand extreme view (south) to my extreme view to my left (north) they were in sight for between 10 and 15 seconds only so i had no time (or thought) to check my watch. my wife also observed these objects at the same time.
whilst not being a total sceptic i have never experienced an observation of this kind before but have living near to farnborough where the famous air show takes place every second year, i have seen the performance of fast military aircraft at fairly close quarters. this certainly did not fit the bill as far as known military aircraft perform.They made no sound as they passed by which also seemed rather strange!
content.summary: 3 star like objects flashed low across the sky

content.detailedDescription: It was about seven thirty that night of feb 1962. my friend and i were watching the night sky for the space capsule,we spotted it? as the capsule was moving from the southwest to the southeast,my friends mother suddenly called him inside! naturally he was upset because of this event that was unfolding before our eyes. he said, he would be back and i would wait! what i'm going to say is the truth! as i was watching mr glenn's spacecapsule,i noticed a small star slowly moving towards the spacecapsule! i watched it for about ten seconds, it seemed to had docked with mr glenn's capsule!? i was 14 yrs old at the time,and asked myself could there be another capsule? about 5 seconds later the starlight object took off about at a 35 to a 40 degree angle, making a v-shape. the speed after the object left the capsule was so darn fast! that it appeared to be a meteor richocheting off the capsule! my friend came back to view spaceflight, i told him what i had just seen! basically he just said i'm seeing things. this took place  in fremont,calif. through out the years ireally never mentioned it to much! not until i saw the movie the "right stuff" did i start to wonder,what was it? in the movie mr glenn reported strange lights appearing around his capsule!?I looked on the internet for further info. found out, there  was some strange powdery ahes still on his spacecraft!?.It's ironic years later. that i would move to phx az, does the phx lights have a connection? wierd! p.S feel free to call me! there is something else.
content.summary: Starlight object approaching john glenn's space capsule
